verses.verse: And it happened during one of those days; as He was teaching the group on the temple grounds and sharing good news, the head priests and the Old Testament transcribers stood over Him together with the older men.
And they said to Him, saying, "Tell us in what kind of authority are You doing these things or who is the one who gave You this authority?"
When He answered, He said to them, "I also will ask you one saying, and you must tell it to Me.
The submersion of John, was it from heaven or from people?"
Together the men considered to themselves, saying, "If we say from heaven, He will state, 'So why didn't you trust him?'
But if we say from people, the entire group will take us down by throwing stones at us. You see, it is a group that has been confident for John to be a preacher."
And they responded not to know where it is from.
And Jesus said to them, "Neither am I telling you in what kind of authority I do these things."
He began to be telling this illustration to the group, "A certain person planted a vineyard, leased it out to farmers, and left the area for an adequate amount of time.
And during the right time, he sent a slave out on a mission to the farmers so that they would give to him out of the fruit of the vineyard, but after the farmers beat him, they sent him off empty.
And he added to this to send a different slave. The farmers also, after beating and belittling that one, sent him off empty.
And he added to this to send a third. The farmers also, after wounding this one, threw him out.
The master of the vineyard said, 'What should I do? I will send my son, the loved one. They will likely be embarrassed when they see this one.'
But when the farmers saw him, they were thoroughly considering to themselves, saying, 'This is the inheritor. Come on. We should kill him so that the inheritance might become ours.'
And after they threw him outside of the vineyard, they killed him. So what will the master of the vineyard do to them?
He will come and ruin these farmers and give the vineyard to others." When they heard this, they said, "It could not happen."
After looking at them, Jesus said, "So, what is this thing that has been written, (in Psalm 118:22) 'A stone that the people who are building, rejected, this became for a corner's head?'
Everyone who falls on that stone will be shattered. On whomever it falls, it will grind him up."

And the head priests and the Old Testament transcribers looked for an opportunity to put their hands on Him in the same hour. And they feared the group. You see, they knew that He told this illustration to them.

And after they watched Him closely, they sent undercover people (that were themselves faking to be people who do what is right) out on a mission so that they might attack His answer for the "to turn Him over to the head ruler and the authority of the leader" part.
And they asked Him, saying, "Teacher, we realize that you are talking and teaching correctly and You don't receive an appearance, but You teach the way of God based on truth.
Is it permitted to us to give a protection fee to Caesar or not?"
After taking a closer look at their slyness, He said to them, "Why are you trying to cause trouble with Me?
Show me a denarius (a fifty-dollar coin). Whose image and inscription does it have?" When they answered, they said, "Caesar's."
Jesus said to them, "Now then, give the things of Caesar back to Caesar and the things of God back to God."
And they didn't have the strength to attack His statement directly in front of the group, and, amazed based on His response, they kept quiet.
When some of the Sadducees came forward (the ones expressing opposition to a return back to life, for it not to exist), they asked Him,
saying, "Teacher, Moses wrote to us, 'If someone's brother dies who has a wife and this one dies childless, that his brother should take the wife and bring up from him a seed for his brother.'
So there were seven brothers, and after the first took a wife, he died childless.
And the second brother took the wife, and this one died childless.
And the third took her. Similarly, even the seven also did not leave children down here and died.
Last of all, the wife also died.
So in the return back to life, whose wife of them does she become? You see, the seven had her as a wife."
And when Jesus answered, He said to them, "The sons of this span of time marry and are given out in marriage.
But the people who are considered deserving to obtain that span of time and the return back to life, the return back to life from the dead, neither marry, nor are given out in marriage.
You see, neither are they able to die anymore; for they are equal to angels, and they are sons of God, being sons of the return back to life.
That the dead are gotten up â€” even Moses disclosed this on the bush as he says, "The Master is the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob."
He is not a God of dead people, but of people living. You see, all are living to Him."
When some of the Old Testament transcribers responded, they said, "Teacher, nicely said."
No longer were they daring to be asking Him anything.
But He said to them, "How do they say the Anointed King is to be a son of David?
Even David himself says in a scroll of Psalms, (in Psalm 110:1) 'The Master said to my Master, Sit down at places to the right of Me
until I put Your enemies as a footrest of Your feet.'
So David calls Him a master. And how is He his son?"
As the entire group was listening, He said to His students,

"Be cautious of the Old Testament transcribers, the ones who want to be traipsing around in long robes and who are fond of greetings in the marketplaces, front benches in the synagogues, and front reclining places in the dinners,
who eat up the houses of the widows and for a sham, pray long prayers. These will receive much more judgment."
